Add action to context menu for a specific layer in the layer tree.

detaileddescription.para:
It is necessary to first call addCustomActionForLayerType() with allLayers=false in order for this method to have any effect.
addCustomActionForLayerType()

memberdef.argsstring: (QAction *action, QString menu, QgsMapLayer::LayerType type, bool allLayers)=0
memberdef.name: addCustomActionForLayerType

briefdescription.para: Add action to context menu for layers in the layer tree.

detaileddescription.para: If allLayers is true, then the action will be available for all layers of given type, otherwise the action will be available only for specific layers added with addCustomActionForLayer() after this call.
If menu argument is not empty, the action will be also added to a menu within the main window, creating menu with the given name if it does not exist yet.

This should be used for interacting and adding widgets and messages to the app's status bar (do not use the native Qt statusBar() method).

detaileddescription.para: With the help of this you can access methods like addFeature, startEditing or stopEditing while giving the user the appropriate dialogs.

briefdescription.para: Add window to Window menu.

detaileddescription.para: The action title is the window title and the action should raise, unminimize and activate the window.

briefdescription.para: Checks available datum transforms and ask user if several are available and none is chosen.

detaileddescription.para:
Dialog is shown only if global option is set accordingly.
true if a datum transform has been specifically chosen by user or only one is available.
3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns the application browser model.

detaileddescription.para:
Using this shared model is more efficient than creating a new browser model for every use.
QGIS 3.4

briefdescription.para: Generate stylesheet.

parameterdescription.para: generated default option values, or a changed copy of them

briefdescription.para: Copy selected features from the layer to clipboard.
Deregisters a locator filter from the app's locator bar and deletes it.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this will block whilst any currently running query is terminated.
Plugins which register filters to the locator bar must take care to correctly call deregisterLocatorFilter() to deregister their filters upon plugin unload to avoid crashes.

briefdescription.para: Returns a feature form for a given feature.

parameterdescription.para: The layer for which the dialog will be created
The feature for which the dialog will be created

briefdescription.para: Add "add layer" action to layer menu.
Invalidate results from the locator filter.

detaileddescription.para: This might be useful if the configuration of the filter changed without going through main application settings.

briefdescription.para: Starts a new blank project.
Opens a new feature form.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns true if dialog was accepted (if shown modal, true otherwise).
l
vector layer
f
feature to show/modify
updateFeatureOnly
only update the feature update (don't change any attributes of the layer) [UNUSED]
showModal
if true, will wait for the dialog to be executed (only shown otherwise)

briefdescription.para: Opens a new layout designer dialog for the specified layout, or brings an already open designer window to the foreground if one is already created for the layout.
Opens the message log dock widget.
Open a url in the users browser.

detaileddescription.para:
By default the QGIS doc directory is used as the base for the URL. To open a URL that is not relative to the installed QGIS documentation, set useQgisDocDirectory to false.
url
URL to open
useQgisDocDirectory
If true, the URL will be formed by concatenating url to the QGIS documentation directory path (prefix/share/doc)
Deprecated
Use QDesktopServices instead

briefdescription.para: Paste features from clipboard to the layer.
This method is only needed when using a UI form with a custom widget plugin and calling openFeatureForm or getFeatureForm from Python (PyQt) and you haven't used the info tool first.

detaileddescription.para: Python will crash bringing QGIS with it if the custom form is not loaded from a C++ method call.
This method uses a QTimer to call QUiLoader in order to load the form via C++. You only need to call this once. After that you can call openFeatureForm/getFeatureForm like usual.
More information here: http://qt-project.org/forums/viewthread/27098/

briefdescription.para: Register a new custom drop handler.

simplesect.para: Ownership of the factory is not transferred, and the factory must be unregistered when plugin is unloaded.

briefdescription.para: Register a new custom drop handler for layout windows.

simplesect.para: Ownership of the factory is not transferred, and the factory must be unregistered when plugin is unloaded.

briefdescription.para: Registers a locator filter for the app's locator bar.

detaileddescription.para:
Ownership of the filter is transferred to the locator.
Plugins which register filters to the locator bar must take care to correctly call deregisterLocatorFilter() and deregister their filters upon plugin unload to avoid crashes.
deregisterLocatorFilter()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Register action to the shortcuts manager so its shortcut can be changed in GUI.
Register a new tab in the vector layer properties dialog.

simplesect.para: Ownership of the factory is not transferred, and the factory must be unregistered when plugin is unloaded.

briefdescription.para: Register a new tab in the options dialog.

simplesect.para: Ownership of the factory is not transferred, and the factory must be unregistered when plugin is unloaded.

briefdescription.para: Triggered when connections have changed.

detaileddescription.para:
This calls reloadConnections in the main application and triggers a signal that is forwarded to the GUI elements that needs to be updated (i.e. the source select dialogs and the browser widgets)
QGIS 3.0

The currentPage argument can be used to force the dialog to open at a specific page.

briefdescription.para: Unregister a previously registered custom drop handler.
Unregister a previously registered custom drop handler for layout windows.
Unregister a previously registered action. (e.g. when plugin is going to be unloaded)

Zooms to the full extent of all map layers.
Zooms to extent of the active layer.
Zooms to the next view extent.
Zooms to the previous view extent.
Emitted whenever current (selected) layer changes.

detaileddescription.para: The pointer to layer can be null if no layer is selected.

briefdescription.para: Signal emitted when the current theme is changed so plugins can change their tool button icons.
This signal is emitted when the initialization is complete.
This signal is emitted when a layer has been saved using save as.
This signal is emitted after a layout designer window is closed.
This signal is emitted when a new layout designer has been opened.
This signal is emitted before a layout designer is going to be closed and deleted.
Emitted when starting an entirely new project.

simplesect.para: This is similar to projectRead(); plugins might want to be notified that they're in a new project. Yes, projectRead() could have been overloaded to be used in the case of new projects instead. However, it's probably more semantically correct to have an entirely separate signal for when this happens.

briefdescription.para: Emitted when a project file is successfully read.

simplesect.para: This is useful for plugins that store properties with project files. A plugin can connect to this signal. When it is emitted, the plugin knows to then check the project properties for any relevant state.

briefdescription.para: QgisInterface Abstract base class defining interfaces exposed by QgisApp and made available to plugins.

detaileddescription.para: Only functionality exposed by QgisInterface can be used in plugins. This interface has to be implemented with application specific details.
QGIS implements it in QgisAppInterface class, 3rd party applications could provide their own implementation to be able to use plugins.
